p: (ii) 1,1-Diphenyl-2-picrylhydrazyl (DPPH) Assay. The DPPH radical scavenging assay was performed according to a previously described method [ 15]. The stock DPPH solution (314 μM) was prepared in absolute ethanol and kept in dark at room temperature until its use. Gallic acid was used as a positive control (IC50: 4.5 μg/mL) and the total extracts were diluted in DMSO at appropriate concentrations. Briefly, in a 96-well plate, 190 μL of the DPPH solution and 10 μL of gallic acid or samples were incubated for 30 min at room temperature protected from light and the absorbance was measured at 517 nm. A negative control containing 10 μL DMSO and 190 μL DPPH was performed each time, as well as blanks containing 10 μL sample and 190 μL EtOH.
